intro: Bupleurum subspinosum, commonly known as the spiny bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided and often have a slightly hairy texture. Bupleurum subspinosum is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments.
